attributes.action: Televised Lower league football via season tickets
attributes.additional_details: Each club outside of the Premier league should have both home and away games televised and sold as season tickets via sky’s broadcast.  This would supply vital income to the clubs via The season ticket, also the fans who go to the games would see the away games. It would also enable local fans who cannot go to the games to watch bringing in new fans.
attributes.background: As part of Sky’s ownership of Premier league football they should be responsible for the 4 leagues.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The decision to televise lower league football would be a decision for broadcasters. 

If you want the Government to provide funding to support lower-league professional and semi-professional football clubs, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330655

If you want the Government to allow football fans to attend matches, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552036
